author: toff9
content:
POS you need to buy basically over half of all eth in circulation, in secret, then stake it, then act like a jerk and risk being slashed for it by the non-malicious nodes. 
POW you need to buy GPU's and ASICS till you have 51% no other stake needed, no active protocol based penalty.

author: capitalism7918
content: So are you saying it would be a bigger commitment to purchase half the staked ETH than it would be to buy half the computing power that ETH runs on?

author: toff9
content: Both of those things are hard what I think POS offers is a nice penalty that targets your stake in the network directly. In the POW scenario you just get more hardware or team up with someone else, hardware which can be reused time and time again.
